item.description:
Level 1 - Open to all kayak types as well as canoes - Wet or Dry Suits strongly recommended

This is our first Halloween Paddle and it may prove to be pretty scary :0 Wear a costume if you'd like or just a silly hat or mask. We'll ride the current up to Exeter Town Landing and invade Exeter with our flotilla of ghosts, goblins and other scary aquatic creatures.

This Event is also posted on the NE Seacoast Paddlers meetup site so if you are a member of that group please RSVP there from the link below

http://www.meetup.com...

Meet at Chapman's Landing off of Rt. 108 Stratham NH and paddle up the Squamscott River into downtown Exeter with the incoming tide. High Tide is approx. 1pm in Exeter. Bring a lunch and Halloween treats as we'll stop at the town landing in Exeter and have a picnic in the adjacent park.

Follow Rte. 108 north from Stratham or south from Newmarket. The boat launch, Chapman's landing is well marked & next to the metal bridge over river.


Water temps are dropping and air temps may be cold so dress appropriately and wear layers. Wet Suits or Dry Suits strongly recommended. As always PFDs AKA Life vests must be worn when paddling with this group

See link below for Google Maps directions to launch site

Chapman's Landing Boat Launch
item.name: Halloween Paddle Squamscott River to Downtown Exeter
